text: Starts of with a lovely roast, followed by sweet fruits. Then red fruits and grains, bourbon and faint whiskey and finally espresso. Mostly sweet with light bitterness. Full bodied. Very complex and quite subtle. Sweet, but not too much. Balanced. Excellent!
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours opaque black with the merest tan head. Coffee, toffee, raisins. Burnt toffee on the taste. Thick. Burnt toast.

Pr√≥bka na WFDP. ≈Åadny profil beczki w aromacie - wanilia, whisky, czekolada, kakao, trochƒô karmelu i toffi i drewna. Dobre cia≈Ço, w smaku wiƒôcej owoc√≥w w czekoladzie wychodzi. Alkohol leciutko wyczuwalny, ale bez wiƒôkszej wady w tym aspekcie. S≈Çodkie, czuƒá trochƒô tych beczek, zar√≥wno wanilii jak i drewna. Dobrze u≈Ço≈ºone, zbalansowane i z≈Ço≈ºone. Zrobi≈Ço wra≈ºenie.

Brown/black coloured ale with a small cream coloured head.

Aroma: bourbon, caramel, malty, sugar and some vanilla.

Taste: sweet, caramel, coffee, raisins, some hard liqour, vanilla and quite hoppy.

Syrupy mouthfeel with not a lot of carbonation.

Bottled. Full 33cl sample. The aroma has chocolate, vanilla/bourbon, raisin, sweetness. Bit hazy, very dark brown/black coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is light bitter, malty sweet with chocolate, vanilla, light boze. Smooth mouthfeel. Pleasant beer.

0,33l bottle at home. Yellow Wax. BB 21.11.2019. black color, small coffee colored head. smells dried fruits, raisins, spices, earthy notes, nice wood, marzipan, nutty, lightly glueish. very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of dried fruits, berry notes, some oxidation, spices, bit peppery, some sweetness, nutty, marzipan, some chocolate notes, nice wood. finishes lightly sweet with notes of marzipan, nutes and dried fruits. very nice one, love the balance, very nice wood, nutty and berry notes.

Bottle at home. Pours black, small -rather dark - head that stabilizes at a very thin layer. Smell is roasty, some coffee, very mild barrel. some rye, I think ? Mild notes of what I believe is whiskey. Taste is fronted by sweetness, a thick, very big maltprofile body follows. Towards the end, you get some very mild (bourbon?) barrel vanilla, and it ends in a big blast of chocolaty aroma ( very pure cocoa ) Very rich flavor profile. No real hops or yeast, as you could imagine. I like it ! Mouthfeel is thick, huge, mild silkyness. Not as thick as a true imperial stout of the same quality of this one, but it comes very close. Carbo is prefectly suiting the beer.

Frisch vom Hahn auf de BGM 01 in Wroclaw getrunken. Dunkles Schwarzbraun im Glas mit beigem Schaum. In der Nase recht unauff√§llig. Sch√∂n ausgepr√§gter K√∂rper durch das BA. Schlie√ülich kommt der Alkohol.

Bottled on Eric the red Moscow. Dark brown with almost no foam, reach sweet toffee and caramel aroma. Full body, malty well-rounded. Very delicious pancake like, barrels on background. Very intensive aftertaste similar to flavor. Highly recommended.
Got it in Riga, Latvia - Alus celle. Bit pricey but worth it. Taste like dark choclate, a lot sweetnes and 11,9 abv heawiness.

Bottle thanks to Blue_Zulu. Pours near opaque brown with a modest brown head which soon recedes. Aroma is cocoa, caramel and oak. Taste is raisins, slightly dusty, cocoa, figs, slightly roasty, a little of boozy heat.
On keg at hanging bat. Pours opaque black. Nose of molasses, treacle, burnt toffee. Taste is roasted coffee beans, raisins, toast.
Keg at the hanging bat.. Dark black.. Thin tan lacing... Soft woody chocolate roast malts nose... Creamy caramel woody chocolate roast malts
UPDATED: JUN 2, 2017 Keg at The Bat. Pours black. Nose is whisky, liquorice, dried fruits, cocoa. Tastes whisky, roast, oats, liquorice, dark fruits, slightly boozy. Excellent.

On tap @ Bergen Craft Beer Fest. Pours black, with a finger thick, mocha head. Aroma is dark roasted malts, with liquorice, cocoa, muscovado and wooden barrels with vanilla and raisins, as well as some dark fruits. Full, creamy body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is dark roasted malts, with liquorice, tobacco, muscovado and wooden barrels, as well as some dark fruits. Lingering dark malty liquorice notes in the finish.
Chocolate, fruits, roasted, barrel aromas and tastes. Slight alcohol, but just completing the beer. Nice body.

Absolutely great aroma, a lot of stuff going on. Whiskey and bourbon are the stars, followed by spicy alcohol, dried fruits and coffee notes. Full body, low carbonation. Sweet and liquorish, you can feel a pleasant burn from the high ABV. I can feel the flavor of a cake my mother makes in the holidays, called ¬íchec¬í in my country. Complex, long-lasting end. One of the best beers I¬íve had so far.
TCBW 2017. Nice! Roasted. Black. Ice cream with m√§mmi. Oats? Awesome breakfast.
0,1l on tap @ TCBW 2017. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts with some chocolate. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, chocolate, alcohol and hops. Good.

Murky brown beer with nice head on top leaving lacing behind as it dissolves. Aroma has porridge. Dark chocolate, cocoa, milk coffee and roasted malts. Taste is sweet with dark chocolate, porridge, malts, vanilla and some alcohol in the end. Full weird porridge texture with lowish carbonation.

On tap at TCBW, Tallinn. Very dark mahogany, close to black, with a beige head. Sweet and malty with dried fruits and caramel. A bit to much on the sweet side for my taste, but complex and interesting flavours. Vinous and fairly enjoyable.

Bottle. Coke brown, with coke-like tiny head. Aroma coffee, oatmeal, wild cherries in brandy. Very full round body really giving the impression of an oatmeal breakfast. Sweet and warmly boozy taste, the cherries-in-brandy element again in the finish. Very good overall, only the ridiculous yellow cap is a bit over the top.

Donker bier met licht mokkakleurige schuimkraag die snel inzakt tot fijn laagje. Aroma en smaken van pruimen, hout, donker fruit, bourbon, vanille, beetje lactose. Zeer soepel in de mond. Mooie zachte afdronk. Lekker genietersbier.
Bottle. Dark brown with almost no head. Sweet, smooth, medium to full body. Not boozy
Strong whisky/bourbon/vanilla aroma. Tastes like it smells. Sweet licorish taste.

Well, the yellow plastic lid over the top of the bottle is cute, but what a hell to actually open the bottle...
Anyway...
Aroma is a weak smell of liquor, and taste is the same (well, on a stronger level)
Lots of alcohol though.
Ar√¥me d un alcool fort (wisky?). En gout, l¬íalccol fort pr√©domine. Bonne onctuosit√©.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 Amennyire t√°vol √°ll√≥nak tartom az er≈ëteljes koml√≥zotts√°got a stoutok vil√°g√°t√≥l, olyannyira √∂sszef√©rhet≈ëek p√©ld√°ul az imperial stoutok, a barley wine-ok, az old ale-ek, vagy √©ppen az american strong ale-ek st√≠lusjegyei, mint ahogyan ez a kavalk√°d a Porridge Bullet eset√©ben megfigyelhet≈ë. Ez teljes m√©rt√©kben az √©n terepem, a k√≥lasz√≠n≈± testek alatt hasonl√≥ el≈ëjelek eset√©n √°ltal√°ban feledhetetlen √©lm√©nyek lapulnak. Marcip√°nos, rumos-konyakos, lik≈ërben √°zott fadong√°s, k√∂rt√©s, tiramisus t≈±zij√°t√©k, m√°r amit az illatai produk√°lnak, melyhez hasonl√≥an kirobban√≥, intenz√≠v √©s izgalmas jegyekkel telet≈±zdelt √≠zvil√°g p√°rosul. A k√≥kuszos,van√≠li√°s, bourbon hord√≥ban √©rlelt imperial stoutok h√∂mp√∂lyg≈ë mal√°tafolyam-karaktere √©pp√∫gy felfedezhet≈ë benne, mint a quadrupelek s√ºtem√©nyes-di√≥s hangulata, s a barley wine-ok f≈±szeres zamatai. √ñsszetetts√©g√©nek s√∫ly√°hoz m√©rten kiss√© tal√°n v√©konynak is t≈±nhet a szerkezet, amely otthont ad a show-nak, az izgalmak t√°rh√°za azonban k√∂nny≈±szerrel √°ll ellen minden kekecked√©snek, sz√°momra legal√°bbis az egyik nagy favorit a f≈ëzet.

Bottled. Hazy and deep amber body with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, bchocolate, vanilla, wood and bourbon. Sweet flavor that ends up slightly more dry with some alcohol. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Strong Ale. üåüüåüüåüüåü
Pours brown with beige mid head. In nose raisins maltyness and barrel notes, like wood or vanilla and small amount of alcohol. In taste multi grain :), smooth mouth feel, sweetness, full body.

Whisky, vanila, wood, caramel, coffee and chocolate in nose. Pours dark brown with beige head. Taste is medium sweet to sweet with caramel, chocolate, whisky, vanilla, maple syrup, caffe latte. Medium bitter finish, soft carbo, average body, well hidden ABV. Overall very good sipper.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Blackish brown body. Creamy brown head.
Nose of liquorice, bourbon, wood, roast, vanilla, whisky, liquor, malt, caramel...
Flavours of bourbon, vanilla, bitter, toast, malts, caramel, whisky, light honey, deliciously balanced...
Aftertaste is malty, bourbon, vanilla, caramel, light bitter...
Low carbo, silky mouthfeel, medium to full bodied.
Delicious!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Bottled 330ml (Alko)
Opaque black color, small steady brownish head, Aroma has roasted malts, lactose, whisky, vanilla. Medium to full-bodied. Smooth palate. Vanilla, toasted malts, oak. Sweetish, balanced. Hides ABV nicely, some warming feeling in the aftertaste. Good.

Dark cola brown with no head. A bunch of yellow wax floaties because of the stupid wax seal on the bottle. Smells like marzipan and bad whiskey. Tastes like oil, dark berries, and alcohol. What a garbage beer.
Bottle at home. Sweet taste of coffee, liquorice, dried fruits, marzipan, figs, wood and whisky. Slightly dry aftertaste. Full/medium, soft mouthfeel but some metal.

Bottle. Deep brown liquid wiht thin beige top. Softly carbonated but big bubbles.
Aroma is very strong and faceted - hints of vanilla, whiskey, oak barrel, cardamum, chocolate, fresh malt, rye bread and coffee beans.
Texture is somewhat oily and syrupy, but taste is splendid! It is kind of sweet but well balanced, has roasted bread, chocolate, whiskey, honey and dark berries. Marvellous! Well, to be honest I can almost feel as I am eatin the beer, not drinking it - it feels so stodgy as very rich and sweet morning porridge indeed. And alcohol can barely be felt in taste but gives nice warm feeling in stomach.
Will definitely drink again.

Dark brown color with just a bit of tan foam with big bubbles. Aroma has some spicy barrel notes and some booze with dark malts in the background. Taste is spicy with some rye bread and whiskey, sweet and malty at first but the finish has a light roasted grain spiciness. Medium body, soft carbonation. Quite nice overall but a bit too spicy for my taste.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2017 (bottle)Aroma:vanilla,oat cookies,intensive coconut smell, bit woody.Appearance:dark brownish color, frothy small beige head.Taste:sweet,flavour of vanilla,milk chocolate,coconut,whiskey bit roasty,sweet vanilla-driven finish.Palate:close to full body,low to medium carbonation.Overall:Yummy! rich vanilla-driven brew, smells like a top notch barley wine,intensive notes of barrel boost the aftertaste and make it even more complex.

Textur?? Oily As Hell!! Smell?? K√ºhl bourbig und voller Kastanien Blow Outs. Hossa!! Ganz geil. Hail!! HOP ATTACK!! Ab jetzt geht¬ís richtig in die Tiefe. Der Gummigott und Sister Liquorice sind definitiv an Bord üòâ. Der Rest?? Anscheinend Makulatur. Er treibt uns auf die Spitze. Hopfensourmalzmatsche die noch Minuten sp√§ter am Gaumen klebt. Schoko‚ö° .Peng!! Ich bin amazed ‚ò∫. Auch Leder&Co lassen sich nicht lumpen...gut so üôÇ. Komplexer&FAThardlineiger geht¬ís nimmer. Harzhopsourpower!!!! 0,33/3,95¬Ä. Das Wachs war gebrochen üò™. Machte nichts üòç. Nice Price for A Fantastic Brew...Bottle from Haarlem,NL.

Data wa≈ºno≈õci:  21.11. 2019 
 Kolor:  Ciemnobrunatny. PatrzƒÖc pod ≈õwiat≈Ço ca≈Çkowicie klarowny wraz z rubinowymi refleksami. 
 Piana:  Delikatna, be≈ºowa, zbudowana z drobniutkich oczek.
Jedynie centymetr puchu go≈õci≈Ç na powierzchni. Po kilku ≈Çykach pozosta≈Ça ju≈º tylko milimetrowa otoczka. Do krawƒôdzi szk≈Ça przyklejajƒÖ siƒô punktowe plamki. 
 Zapach:  W aromacie jak nie spos√≥b siƒô nie domy≈õleƒá zbo≈ºa. Mn√≥stwo ≈ºyta, pszenicy i p≈Çatk√≥w owsianych. Tu≈º obok nieko≈ÑczƒÖca siƒô s≈Çodycz karmelu, toffi i s≈Çodkiej czekolady deserowej.
Beczkowa strona trunku jest wyra≈∫nie wyeksponowana. Nie ma napisane jakiej beczki, czy beczek u≈ºytyo. Po ilo≈õci wyczuwalnych nut dƒôbowych i wanilii stawia≈Çbym w ciemno na bourbon, lub ewentualnie whisky.
W oddali leciutki alkohol, kt√≥ry tylko zgrabnie zawiƒÖzuje ca≈ÇƒÖ wo≈Ñ. 
 Smak:  W smaku intensywnie s≈Çodowe. Mamy mn√≥stwo karmelu, p≈Çatk√≥w owsianych i pszenicy.
Dodatkowo smak podkre≈õlajƒÖ czekoladowe detale.
Troszeczkƒô z ty≈Çu ukrywajƒÖ siƒô bli≈ºej nieokre≈õlone ciemne owoce.
Beczka wspaniale podkre≈õla g≈Ç√≥wne walory trunku. Spora doza dƒôbowej beczki, wanilii i nut drewnianych.
Gdzie≈õ tam w oddali mu≈õniƒôcie laktozy. Tekstura oleista, kisielowata.
Alkohol nie jest jeszcze w pe≈Çni u≈Ço≈ºony. Czuƒá jak rozgrzewa w piersi i w gardle.
Gdyby nie ca≈Çkowity brak nut palonych pomy≈õla≈Çbym, ≈ºe to jaki≈õ RIS:)
Bardzo dobry trunek! 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:   

Pohjala nie przestaje zaskakiwaƒá. Jeszcze do niedawna genialny Odravein, a teraz ju≈º kolejny sztos. Tym razem Wieloziarnisty ≈öniadaniowy Ajl.
Zawiera pszenicƒô, jƒôczmie≈Ñ, ≈ºyto, owiec i laktozƒô.
Piwo ≈õwietnie u≈Ço≈ºone z akcentami czekolady, karmelu, toffi, ciemnych owoc√≥w.
Beczka wspaniale wp≈Çywa na smak i aromat, ale nie dominuje piwa bazowego. 
≈öwietny trunek!
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is caramel, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, taste is similar, chewy, sweet.
Drank with Lennart at his place 23-3-17. Awesome beer. Thick, rich, very good taste. Awesome.

Bottle from Mother Kelly¬ís in London. Damn dogg, Pohjala is -bal aging. Lord have mercy on us all. Breakfast beer? If this is how you start your day, then you just might be a raging alcoholic. Well that¬ís exactly what I am. This beer pours dark brown with a fading tan head. The aroma is big bourbon, roast, coffee, and dark chocolate. The flavor is clean, medium sweet, malty, bourbony, Tootsie Roll. Medium-full bodied, somewhat hot, but quite slick and smooth. Damn tasty.
Bottle at drink baar, tallinn. Black color, brown head. Aroma has lots of roasted malts, coffee, oak, some raisins. Smooth and full body, coffee, sweet berry notes, some bread.

Bottle. Pours black with creamy light brown head. Aroma has vanilla, roasted malt, some alcohol. Taste has vanilla, roasted malt, brown sugar, suryp and caramel. Very sweet and great beer! Alcohol can¬ít be felt in taste too much.

Bottle from Drinks & Gifts, yellow wax, batch 344 BB 21 11 19, 33 cl sample. Dark color, short frothy head. Aroma of bourbon and vanilla, bourbon and cookie, bourbon and whole grain cookie. Quite sweet toffee and caramel, bit raisin, vanillq ofcourse, slight boozy, quite some whole grain cookie. Great complexity. A little bit pricy, but taste does not disappoint.

Intensywny, czekoladowo-kawowy aromat. W smaku podobnie. Nie jest za gƒôste, sporo nut kokosowo-waniliowych, finisz s≈Çodkawy. Nie ma praktycznie palono≈õci, co jest bardzo ciekawe, bo pozosta≈Çe walory sƒÖ piƒôknie wyeksponowane. Bardzo dobre.

Black pour, deep, creamy tan head. Malty aroma with syrup and brown sugar. Some oats and a hint of coffee. Bitter taste, plenty of roasted malts, rich flavours. Ouly mouthfeel, soft carbonation, Very nice, flavourful beer,

Bottle @ Van Moll Brewpub shared with Erwin Van Moll. Opaque pitch black color, decent sized off-white head. Aroma is malts, bourbon. Taste malts, bourbon, roasty, sweet, slightly vanilla in the background, some alcohol. Thick texture, medium to full body, suitable carbonation. Nice beer.

Aroma: citrusy notes, malts, dark caramel, chocolate, cognac, a bit sweetly.
Appearance: dark brown color, small brown head.
Taste: caramel, toffee, dried fruits, medium bitterness, citrusy hops, a bit alcohol, roasted malt in background, medium bitterness.
Palate: full body, smooth, alcohol warmth, low carbonation.
LCI. Poured from the bottle. Great strong ale. Incredible taste (chocolate, dried fruit, roasted malts) and thick bodied, full and rich. Lovely!

Black beer with very small and quickly vanishing head. Aroma has caramel malts, vanilla, oak, raisins, plum and portwine. Alcohol is there, but in a good way. Taste has sweet malts, caramel, vanilla, dark fruits, oak and some chocolate. Sweet, but still in good balance. Full body, very soft and wonderful overall. Estonian brewery number one, beer number one. Only minus is the missing foam.
Cognac barrel aroma, some vanilla and taste is also like cognac. Bitter alcohol at aftertaste. Cannot feel much beer in this drink. It¬ís just so strong. Not for me.

Bottle shared at home. Pitch blackcolour, small lighbrown foam with medium retention. Nose is roasted malts, cocoa, coffee, wood, vanilla light booze. Taste is light bitterness, faint roasted malts. Strong wood and vanilla, light coca notes. Like a great whiskey. Smooth mouthfeel, low carbonation well hidden alcohol. A true masterpiece.

330ml bottle. Pours dark brown, big bubbly beige head stays. Aroma is boozy, woody, cognac, raspberry, mildly roasty, jammy, some chocolate, raisins, bit barleywine-ish. Bittersweet dark chocolate, rum, cognac, booze, cherry, tart red berries, wood in taste. Long boozy, chocolate liqueury aftertaste. Quite easily drinkable, well balanced, rich, almost full-bodied, medium carbonated boozy warming beer. Probably ageing makes it even more interesting, I will open next one after 5 years and rerate this.

33 cl bottle @ home. Batch #345, BBE 21.11.2019
Aroma has strong and sweet bourbon and liquor tones. Also mildly salty licorice. Flavour is sweet with salty licorice, bourbon, liquor, some pot coffee and ash. Also heavy fruitiness typical to american strong ales. Finishes with herbal notes, hops and licorice. A slow sipper, something between american strong and imperial stout. And the stout is winning.

330ml bottle from Alko. BBE 29.11.19. Pours black with a thick head. Aroma of brown sugar, wood, vinous notes, oak, hints of roastiness, earthiness and berries. Taste is heavy, sweetish and syrupy with loads of woody notes, oak, toffee, some roastiness, vanilla, liquor and sherry. Finish is heavy, super sweet and vinous with loads of oak, wood, hints of roastiness and syrup. Quite complex and sweet, maybe a bit too sweet for me though.

Bottle shared. Near black with a small tan head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, oak barrel, caramel, toffee and chocolate. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with a thick texture and soft carbonation.
Sampled from bottle at kermis¬ís. Non sarcastic thanks to kermis. Sweet roasted barley malts. Medium sweet and light bitter. Over medium body and low carbonation.

Bottle shared thanks to kermis. Almost black with bubbly dark beige head. Sweet bourbon and vanilla, toffee, rye bread, oats, caramel, lots of sweet chocolate. Quite sweet and under medium bitterness. Over medium bodied.
W aromacie sporo waniliny, czerwonych owoc√≥w, przypalonego karmelu, rodzynek. W smaku pe≈Çne, sporo posmak√≥w beczki oraz rodzynek. Bardzo wyklejajƒÖce pe≈Çne piwo. G≈Çadkie i zdradziecko pijalne.
0,33l fles gedeeld bij lion. bruin met een creme kraag. Rum en chocolade biscuit in de afdronk
Amazing BA beer! Aroma is sweet bourbon cake. Molasses, caramel, vanilla, oak, toasted, chocolate, nutty,... Taste is sweet, finely carbonated, bourbon finish. Very nice brew.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a small, dark latte-colored head. Aroma is vanilla, strong caramel, dried fruit, some roast. Taste is vanilla, caramel, dried fruit, slight oat, dark fruit. Full. Good sipper.
Goed bier. Zachte caramel, vanille, chocolade (natuurlijk), hout kortom een volwarme smaakexplosie.

330 ml. bottle. BBF 27.11.19. Very dark brown, creamy mocha head, quickly vanishing. Nose is thick creamy sweet bourbon syrup with faint roasted oak, nose carries something recognizably signature P√µhjala, molasses, very thick syrupy, vanilla oak with faint touch of roast, nutmeg, almost faint licorice but heavy on the vanilla oak with some bourbon. Taste is interesting, many layers, prunes, figs, rum raisins upfront, warming, bourbon, brandy, rum etc. leading into cherries soaked in alcohol, chocolate syrup, warming in the finish, big vanilla, exotic sugar, cake with brandy and other spirits, deep complex, booze soaked dark fruits, dark cherries, mocha, marzipan, chocolate, multiple spirits, vanilla. Flavours interchange, follow up one and another in complex sequence. Body is syrupy with thin carbonation like Coca-Cola going flat. Very rich, complex decadent,... gorgeous beer. Small plastic "wax"-like thing going on here which looks stupid and pointless, quite amazing otherwise. By very, very far the best I have had from P√µhjala so far, shockingly beer than most of their beers.

Strong/medium, slightly pungent aroma with dark fruits and licorice backed with bourbon background. Black/dark brown color with no head. Strong, balanced taste with bold licorice and bit roasted malts freshened by organic, dark berries like plum and some more bitter varieties. Some barrel, bourbon/alcohol and earthy notes on background. Wide taste spectrum and long aftertaste with roasted, sweetish malts. Strong body with medium/low carbonation. Overall, great quality though not so distinctive. Despite the voltage and strong taste, the nuances are gratifyingly fresh.

Bottle, alko webshop. Black. Intense, sweetness, sweet soy sauce, rich malty, roasty, soft coffee beany, maple syrup. Full bodied, intense, smooth oaky, intense, light molassy, kinda drinkable still. This is probably the first pohjala cellar thingy that I truly like. The others were intense, massive, and deserved a good score, but this feels more elegant refined, balanced. Real nice.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

33cl bottle at home from Bert¬ís Bierhuis Biltstraat, Utrecht. Nose is cocoa. Body is pitch black, head is small, brownish, creamy, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Aroma is tons of cocoa, tonka bean, roasted malt, dried fruits. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting roasty medium bitter, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation. Quite heavy dessert beer, interesting, tasty, nice one.

Dark, basically black beer with a thick one-finger light brown head. Big aroma of oak, whisky, dark sugar, a little licorice, dark chocolate and dark malts. Very multi-faceted aromas. Lovely mouthfeel, very low carbonation and full body. Some sweet stickiness that could be toned down a bit. Initial flavours are again whisky, dark malt, raisin, finishes with chocolate, a good bit of warming from the alcohol and a tiny reminder from the hops. Again, not completely my favourite flavours; yet, just a lovely beer.

33cl bottle shared at home. Dark brown with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium to full body with low to moderate carbonation. Bitter and sweet tones. Grain, rye, raisin, booze, caramel and malts. A tad too boozy.

Small dark tan head, fast gone over brownblack beer with an orange rim. Rich alcoholic, fusely nose. Lots of chocolate, mild & black; vinous, lots of vanilla, Bourbon-like; dark plums, ready to ferment. Sweet, chocolate, alcohol. Dark fruit (plums, grapes). Just a tad of woody bitterness retronasal. More vanilla, orangepeel. Feels well-carbonated and extremely rich & well-bodied. Big - indeed. Pleasing - absolutely. Original - not really.  Yeeeeew. Somehow, the waxplague infected faraway Estonia too. I didn¬ít, but felt as if I had to deduct a point. In order to contain the disease.

Bottle from Speciaalbierpakket. Aroma is oak, lots of vanilla, bourbon, dark malt, oats, caramel, whiskey, sweet toffee, fudge, butterscotch, rum, touch of creamy milk chocolate, some alcohol. Flavour is sweet and a bit boozy. Body is full. Very heavy on the barrel notes, perhaps a bit too much for my taste. That being said, this is a very refined beer.
Pours black colour with some head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, liquorice, vanilla, bourbon. Balanced and very complex aroma. Medium body, quite alcoholy and sweet aftertaste.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 33cl bottle.
Appearance:An opaque black beer with a slight/medium brown head.
Aroma:Very mallty, cereals, caramel, wood, tanine,bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, roasted malts and a bit of spices.
Taste:Moderate sweet with malts,cereal tones, dark bread, caramel, wood, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, black currant hints,nuts, roasted malty bitter and dry finish, with a bit of spices, nuts and coffee. Good long lasting aftertaste.
Full body, below average carbonation.
Really amazing beer.

Bottle at WilliamK Kurvi. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, bourbon, bread, vanilla, coffee, dark fruits, a bit of oak and alcohol. Bitter finish with roasted malts, bourbon, oak, coffee, dark fruits, alcohol, bread and a bit chocolate. Sublime brew, but feels slightly raw still, could benefit from some time in cellar.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2017 
Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malta, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, roasted malts and spices.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. What an amazing range of barrels they aged this on. It could be any combination of bourbon, cognac, sherry and/or rum. Great amount of roasted malts and chocolate to back it up. Amazingly balanced blend.

A black beer, a head is almost medium, brown and quickly decreasing. Aroma has strong, riped and dryed fruitness with raisins and dates, port wine, some chocolate and roastiness, also notes of barrel and alcohol. Taste is intensive, but also balanced. Rich and complex dryed fruitness, dates, chocolate, balanced roastiness, some barrel and alcohol, hint of vanilla. Quite high sweetness but still balanced. Very smooth, full bodied and pleasant to drink. Marvellous beer, complex and greatly balanced. Dryed fruitness with notes of darker maltyness.

Bottle from Alko (11.9%). Pours black colour with some head. Aroma of lightly roasted, oat, chocolate, caramel, liquorice, vanilla, bourbon/sweet liquor, sweetness, fruitiness. Balanced and complex aroma. Thick body, quite alcoholy and sweet taste, long sweet aftertaste.

Bottle, 11.9 %. Dark brown in color with a tan head. Vinous barrel notes, dark ripe fruityness, vanilla spicyness and sweetness in aroma. Soft and smooth mouthfeel, bit of oily vibes as well. Sweetness, dark ripe fruityness, raisins and plums in taste. Easy drinking stuff. Light roasted notes, chocolatey bitterness and vinousness in the end.

330 ml bottle
Dark cola colored beer with little beige head. Aroma of whiskey and vanilla. Flavor has sweet dark malts and caramelly malts, vanilla, whiskey, red wine, licorice and chocolate. A nice bite of hops as well. A bit boozy. Like an imperial and barrel aged version of N√∏gne √ò¬†God Jul.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - batch 345 - BB 211119, from Alko Viikki, 20171118) The beer poured black. Its head was small and lightly brown. Aroma had vanilla, wood and burnt malts. Palate was full bodied, warming and rather dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were wood, vanilla, burnt malts, chocolate and bitterness. Aftertaste had vanilla, sweetness, burntness and bitterness. A quite pleasant brew despite the strong barrel notes.

(P√µhjala Cellar Series - Porridge Bullet) Bottle 330ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 11.9%
Picth black colour on the body, small dark brown head on top with good density and retention.
Aroma of roasted malts, oats, alcohol, dark fruits.
Taste of oats, liquorice, roasted malts, plenty of alcohol, light dark fruits, chocolate.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Nice one, good sipper.

Butelka. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Praktycznie brak piany. Aromat srednio intensywny. Bourbon, bardzo slodka wanilia, gorzka czekolada, kawa, troszke ciemnych owocow. W smaku intensywna wanilia, doskonala beczka, sporo czekolady, kakao, finisz wzmocniony jeszcze wiƒôksze dawkƒÖ beczki po bourbonie. Konsystencja gƒôsta, pe≈Çna. 

Bardzo dobre piwo. Kompleksowe, fajnie zbalansowane z doskonale ukrytym alkoholem.

Bottle. Sensoric. Moderate roasted malts - chocolate, coffee, also moderate vanilla, bourbon, lightly dark fruits - mainly raisins. Finish is harsh, ashy and slightly acidic. Very drinkable, well balanced, moderate ABV warming. Body could be thicker. Hmm despite high ABV content, this could be good choice for a breakfast ;) Decent brew, well balanced, rather simple, but keeps good level.

33cl bottle. Very dark, clear brown pour with a thin tan head. Rich and complex aroma, including notes of bourbon, sherry, red wine, coffee, raisins and other dried fruit. The taste follows the same notes, very well balanced and complex, with medium bitterness, medium to high sweetness, a bit of spiciness and an alcoholic (though not unpleasant) finish. Smooth texture, low carbonation. A great beer, really strong, but very well executed.

Wyrazisty Bourbon, wanilia, czekolada, trochƒô palƒÖcy finisz. G≈Çadkie, s≈Çodkie, u≈Ço≈ºone. ≈öwietne piwo.
Bottle 0.33 l, with again the annoying plastic wax that¬ís nearly impossible to remove.

330 ml bottle. #345. 11.9%. At the Konttori, Tampere, Finland.
Dark reddish brown color with a tiny off-white. 
The aroma is sweetness, whiskey, sugar and dark malt.
The flavor is sweetness, sugar, whiskey, dark malt and molasses. It¬ís getting really sweet when warms up.

Bottle, with again the annoying plastic wax that¬ís nearly impossible to remove. Black pour. Aroma of milky vanilla, creamy malt, bourbon, red fruit, caramel and toffee. Taste has sticky caramel fudge, bourbon vanilla, sweet toffee, raisin, ripe fruit, oak, creamy malt, milk chocolate and a nice sweet fudgy vanilla finish. This is a true gem, delicious.

33 cl bottle (11.9% abv) @ Olutravintola Konttori.
Pours dark red, almost black color with no head. Nice sweet aroma, vanilla, oily malty notes, licorice and some grain. Flavor is licorice, vanilla, toasted malts, some grain. Velvety smooth palate with some tingling wooden notes.
5325

Bottle at home (bb 21 11 19 344). Aroma of vanilla, alcohol, bourbon, cognac, wood, roasted malts, dark chocolate, liquorice, dark fruits, raisins. Taste is moderate to over moderate sweet and moderate bitter, warming alcohol dark chocolate aftertaste. Nice.

330ml bottle. Dark brown beer, almost no head. Nose is chocolate, malt, alcohol, berries, licorice. Flavor is woody, chocolate, malty sweetness, some woody notes, cocoa dust. Finish is slightly boozy, barrely, berries, chocolate. Fairly balanced, woody.

Bottle 0.33l at Brewdog Helsinki, Helsinki. BBE 21 11 19. Colour is almost black with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Chocolate, dryness, vineous elements, berries, some hints of licorice and roasted malts. Interesting but needs drinkability. Too much red wine elements for me. Aroma is great.

Pours deep dark mahogany, not much carbonation (or head) to speak about - but you are not really after stuff like that in barrel aged blends anyway. Aroma has everything: sweet cocoa, bitter chocolate, milk chocolate, bit of booze, toffee, vanilla and ice cram float. Taste is also displaying various characteristics - definitely some alcohol warmth, in a nice way. Sweet dry cocoa, syrupy burnt caramel coating in the mouth, with more caramel and melted bitter chocolate in the mid-taste. Aftertaste is not overly complex, just the same things you can already feel in the taste. Overall, enjoyable barrel aged blend, very balanced and drinkable. Definitely ready for drinking, not sure if ageing would improve it or not.

Kolor: ciemnobrunatny, lkko zamglony.
Piana: nikska, drobnopƒôcherzykowa, w miarƒô trwa≈Ça.
Zapach: intensywne aromaty s≈Çodowe, s≈Çodkie, karmelowe, przypiekane, melanoidynowe, trochƒô czekolady, kakao, aromaty beczek na dalszym planie, ale r√≥wnie≈º do≈õƒá wyra≈∫ne.

Wysycenie: ≈õrednie.
Bottle. Pours black with beige head. Aroma is vanilla, raisins, bourbon. Taste has some coffee, dark berries, chocolate and notes of oak and cognac. Full body, medium carbonation. Very good.
Almost black with small beige head. Sweet grainy aroma. Slight sweet with remarkable sourness followed by strong roasted bitterness. Lasting bitter aftertaste.
Black liquid with brown minimal head. Aroma of oak, hay, booze. Taste has hay liqeur, rye, oak, chocolate. Heavy sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Full body, oily feel, average carb,

Pours dark brown with brown head. Aroma: sweet, toffee, butterscotch, chocolate, hints of vanilla and bourbon. Taste: sweet with some bitterish, rioasted, butterscotch, chocolate, nice milk coffee notes, candish. Full body. Good.
Feels barley wineish malty mix, with nice BA impact, very smooth and balanced, bit sticky. Some roast, choco, wood. Mostly sweet with moderate bitterness. Lovely sipper

Bottle - 11,9% ABV. Dark body, small tan head. Mildly raisiny aroma with a bit of barrel oak and some cognac or other spirit influence. Sweet raisiny taste with oak and a touch of booze heat (but not offensive). Mouthfeel is light and almost airy compared to similarly dark BA Cellar Series beers that are stouts (Taanilinn, Pime √ñ√∂ PX) - looking at this dark body, it¬ís difficult not to expect such imperial stout level intensity and heavy roast but this ale maintains its relative lightness to the end. Good one, but kind of left me wanting a bigger hit of flavours.

Bottle at Speakeasy. Didn¬ít take notes but anyway. Nuanced aroma and flavour of an array of malty and hard liquory goodness, really difficult to pin anything down specifically... Perhaps even a bit too rounded? The alcohol is well covered, I mean, it is boozy but I expect that from a +12% beer. It¬ís got a smooth, soft mouthfeel, and moderate carbonation. Will give the bottle I bought some time and then analyse it more thoroughly.

Appearance: black, clear, brown foam, minimal head, disappears almost immediately. Aroma: bread soup with raisins, sharp alcohol, cocoa. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness. Palate: full body, oily feel, creamy, flat, long bitter, slightly abrupt finish.

Tap. Pitch black color. Medium size, brown head, stays. Woody, cognac, sweet, roast, vanilla, pink cotton candy in aroma. Cognac, roast, vanilla, oak, woody, chocolate in taste. Chocolate cake, woody, cognac in aftertaste. Smooth in mouth, but also boozy. Although not that boozy that it would disturb me. Nice balance. Excellent brew.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2017 Tap at speakeasy
 Pours dark brown-black with brownish head. Aroma is sweet, booze, rum, some roast, dark chocolate, raisins. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, dark chocolate, malt, fruits, rum, vanilla, booze. Finish is dark chocolate bitter. Overall: very good, but bit too boozy. Rating: 7:4:8:4:15=3.8

Bottle. Pours dark brown with nice brownish head. The head stays. Aroma is like on tap. Flavor is also similar, but a lot more rough and boozy, making it really hard to drink. Rating for bottle: 7:5:6:2:12=3.2--

On tap at Speakeasy. Dark brown, almost black colour. Modest beige head. Milk chocolate, cocoa, creamy notes, slight nutiness in the aroma. Chocolate at first. Notes of oak and whiskey in the middle. Dry, bitter finish. Notes of whiskey and bitter chocolate in the end. Slight alcochol, maybe some cocoanibs as well. Notes of good booze and bitter chocolate in the aftertaste. Also sweetness. Oily texture, rather heavy bodied, medium carbonated, quite well balanced abd interesting brew.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2016 330ml bottle (Drink Baar, Tallinn) (7:4:7+:4:15=3.7+)
Looks good, but the hard plasticky wax is completely wanky, nearly as bad as the candle-wax from prior beers, don¬ít do that please. Lovely sweet butter and barley-winey aroma. More of a roast in the taste, still loads of butter, soft spirits. Bit of raisins points to a sherry barrel (not pukey PX, a proper sherry), but its so butter there must be bourbon too. Super soft mellow palate, just a little bit of warming from the spirits, but it¬ís sweet enough to not feel hot. Lovely sipper. Anyone who likes these BA things and doesn¬ít give this 4.x will surprise me greatly. Finish is woody, spirity, oooh, a bit more cognacky woodiness now, there¬ís even a little dryness. OK, that¬ís bittering hops, I¬ím glad they¬íve not been forgotten about. Yeah, this is really nice, even if they did pour in just a bit too much barrel. Still need to buy some keepers...
Rerate of: 330ml bottle - thanks random bloke in Koht! (couple of sip) (7:4:7:4:14=3.6)
Amazing aroma, not very beery, or even barrel aged, this is dominated by musky (aftershavey) perfume. Rich malty body, but such a tonne of soft sweet barrely inputs. Esters and vapors high, but actual woodiness low. Good enough for me to want to buy a couple of my own.
Rerate: Tap (Speakeasy, Tallinn) (7:4:7-:3:13=3.4-)
some bourbon here, but woodiness of cognac too. Taste humms with alohol too. More bourbon than cognac now. Ah, this beer is a substrate for spirits. Pretty nice, but beer with stuff added, meh. Pretty sure I could make this at home, I can even use whisky rather than whiskey. This is actually hot in the mouth.

very thin head, prunes, dried fruits, spices, wood, chocolate in nose. tastes a bit like a barrel aged barley wine, sweet vanilla notes. has some balancing acidity and bitterness in aftertaste a lot of complex flavours, alcohol is warming but not overpowering. Overall drinkable and very interesting complex character.
